##This is how we're going to get through three months | deep web

Micro-signal Qqshenwang

Features, tencent news products, deep web is an original in-depth report, mining technology and TMT hot companies, events and people in the hidden stories, to explore the underlying logic.

Author | Enron editor | Kang Xiao
Production | Deep Net tencent Xiaoman studio

Welcome to download tencent news APP for more quality information

Editor's Note: Crossing the economic cycle of the epidemic requires the upstream and downstream industries in China to work together to tide over the difficulties, how to deal with the offline branch temporarily closed, how to account for the company's cash flow and ensure the safety of employees and other issues.

Four days before the Chinese New Year, the company called on all staff to be on call 24 hours a day to take the initiative to suspend the offline operations of more than 2,000 of its offline educational institutions, within a dozen days of the outbreak, squirrel AI has been in "a state of readiness. ".

"during the outbreak, we had to make sure that the company's cash flow would keep us alive for two years, " Ai Founder Li Haoyang told deep web.

The Squirrel AI former Nghe School, founded in 2014. Since its establishment, it has received four rounds of financing with a total amount of nearly $1 billion. In June 2018, Nghe Education launched the "Squirrel AI" brand, with algorithm as the core, in the field of K12 education to launch an artificial intelligence adaptive learning engine. In 2018, the company's revenue nearly 1 billion, 2019 has opened nearly 2,000 offline teaching center.

Li Haoyang, the founder of Ai Squirrel, describes how the company handled the suspension of more than 2,000 offline educational institutions over a period of more than 10 days, how to account for the company's cash flow and ensure the safety of its employees.

Company-wide Combat Readiness Level One

Four days before the Spring Festival, the company went into a state of war. At that time, I sent a message to the group, asking all the staff of the company to be on call 24 hours a day. Even on New Year's Eve, many people were busy until midnight. In these four days, our work is divided into three main parts. One is to inform principals all over the country to unify their thinking, for the sake of children's health, to take the initiative to stop offline classes, and urge principals to implement.

At that time, some principals complained that the authorities had not asked for the suspension of classes. Why should we? After I explained that the incubation period could also be infected, each principal agreed to suspend classes, which moved me, because suspension means loss.

The second is to train teachers, because we have more than 10,000 offline teachers in the country have no experience of online teaching, we need to focus on training these teachers how to teach online.

Three is to mobilize all staff back to work, some teachers just do not have a sense of crisis, and I complained about their own just started on vacation, how to work in situ. And there are still some employees without computers, we have to focus on resolving the company's employees remote work problems.

I told some of the complaining employees that the company could be in danger if it didn't adjust its pace in time for special times. Therefore, we must change the usual work attitude and speed. It can be said that each employee working conditions and awareness, is the future survival of the company's expectations.

Under the mobilization of the company, all staff this more than 10 days to maintain a "state of readiness" , there are some programmers in their home remote office, ready to solve technical problems. Because wechat has a 9 person limit on teleconferencing, we use QQ to set up video conferencing.

From January 22 to February 3, we held 36 video conferences, the company's employees 80,000 people listen to live video training. The principal's combat readiness handbook, the staff Combat Readiness Handbook, the parent's communication handbook and the student's online study handbook have been produced.

Early on the morning of January 24, we launched an online education training program. At 15:30 that afternoon, junior high school math teaching and research staff began online training. At that time, 5,518 teachers participated in the online training. Those who could not attend the online training also consciously watched the playback when it was convenient for them. After that, English, Chinese and other subjects online teaching and training are carried out in an orderly manner.
We are online and offline, one body two wings, synergy development, offline students in school is also through the computer in the intellectual adaptation system to follow the Squirrel AI virtual teacher to learn. Ai Ai AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI. We have been teaching online for four or five years, and we are relatively experienced. In the process of pushing offline schools to online, there have been twists and turns, but the twists and turns we can bear.

Employees are not allowed to travel in vehicles with more than five passengers

On January 31, the company issued a notice to change the original return time from February 9 to February 15. At the same time, company policy, all employees before February 15 not allowed to use a variety of vehicles. Because I personally feel that on the return journey, the vehicle is probably the biggest hidden danger behind the development of the epidemic. If it were not for transportation, the outbreak would have decreased under the strict control of the state and the efforts of all walks of life. But the vehicles returning for the Spring Festival holiday could cause cross-infection. That's why we don't allow employees to return until the 15th, so they can work remotely from home.

Because we have offices in Beijing, Shanghai and other parts of the country, the company rules 15 starting return staff, not allowed to sit more than 5 people on the transport. Whether you drive or rent a car. Even a tricycle with a mask on is safer than public transportation.

After the return trip, the company stipulates that all activities and work can not be carried out in the office. If an employee needs to communicate face-to-face, we require no more than four people to communicate each time, and must wear a mask, one meter apart from each other in outdoor communication.

Cost cutting, cash flow accounting

Whether the educational enterprise can pass this critical three or four months mainly depends on the cash reserves on the books. We stress-tested the company a long time ago, and we have a consensus within the company that the company's cash flow at any time is always two years of operation, assuming that one year there is no financing, then the following year, the company will have to optimize costs and improve revenue efficiency again to ensure that the company has sufficient cash flow to ensure that the company two years of operation.

Now under the pressure of the epidemic, we re-take stock of the company's cash flow. We have to cut back on our spending and reduce our operating costs at a time when the company's revenues are likely to be sharply reduced. Cut All the costs that could be cut, such as redecorating a third of our new office space, paying down for meetings, marketing, etc. , to keep us alive for two years with our current cash flow.

I see Shanghai announced to extend the Social Insurance Payment period and tax support and other support policies, we are more confident to tide over the difficulties.

What needs to be pointed out here is that after the outbreak, we donated 3 million yuan to the Hubei Youth Foundation, and 2 million to buy computers and other equipment for the students in the affected areas who don't have the equipment at home, 5 million in cash donated by the co-operative schools, and 500 million worth of study accounts donated to the affected areas and users nationwide, all of which we have to spend, it's not part of our cost reduction, it's part of the cost increase during the epidemic.

The reason for giving free accounts to children in the affected areas and across the country is that we hope that every child will not be interrupted by the epidemic and forget their previous knowledge points and do not throw away their previous good study habits. I hope they can arrange their daily study, sports and entertainment. Plan your time well, especially after school starts, don't fall behind the schedule of school.

Some people have questioned whether the Education Company's Free Public Service is draining its customers, but the company's regular class costs hundreds of dollars and only has 16 hours, and this time it's all free and 90 hours, which is part of the real public service.

In addition, in order to enable children in the affected areas to "suspend classes without suspension, " we have worked with Hubei Zhijiang Yingjie school and Yichang Yingjie school to ensure that children attend school at home on time. A few days ago, these two schools have an experimental class opened.

In addition, our co-operation with Shiyan No. 2 Middle School in Hubei Province, Shashi District No. 1 Middle School in Jingzhou, Hubei Province, and Wudu Middle School in Ezhou, Hubei Province, is already in progress. Some students in Hubei Public Schools may use the company's intelligent adaptive system in the near future to solve the problem of delayed start-up.

After three months, education companies will see explosive growth

The problem with offline campuses now is that some parents will ask for refunds if they are unable to open classes for long periods of time, and if they don't have enough cash reserves, they are likely to run into cash flow difficulties, will face fixed costs such as rent, wages and other expenses; third, these months may not have new income enrollment.

Three or four months from now, when the epidemic is over, it will be a chance for us to rise from the ashes and grow at a rapid pace. So I personally believe that every education business must stabilize their cash flow at this time, as long as the difficulties over the past few months, will usher in explosive growth. After the end of the epidemic is expected, the concentration of the education and training market will further enhance.

Two ways for educational institutions in primary and secondary schools to survive

Offline small and medium-sized training institutions to survive this three months, I think there are two ways.

The first is to find a way to solve the cash flow problem, over the past three months. The New Oriental, founded by Yu Minhong in 2003, survived the worst of the crisis with cash reserves and ten million loans, then experienced explosive growth.

The second is to find a big brand of education companies, together with the transformation line, in the current situation, a single small and medium-sized educational institutions alone is difficult to survive.

There are three advantages to combining big-brand education companies with online ones. One is that parents generally have a stronger sense of trust in big brands. With the trust of parents, parents will not be anxious to withdraw tuition fees, the proportion of parents may be reduced from more than 50% to 10% , education institutions can survive the first hurdle. Second, the offline training machine on-line, in this three months before classes can be canceled, pre-paid tuition can be turned into cash flow, after parents have the possibility of renewal fees. Otherwise, even if the parents do not have a centralized refund, formal education institutions can not spend these pre-paid tuition fees, no cancellation of tuition fees do not count as company income, this is the consensus in the industry. Third, in terms of new admissions, the months of the epidemic do not mean that there is no income from new admissions at all. The online marketing capabilities and experience of brands themselves are stronger, as some brands are giving away free accounts during the epidemic, and if parents and students have a particularly good learning experience during these months, some parents choose to keep their children online after the outbreak, while others choose to enroll in high value-added courses.

I estimate that over the course of three or four months, 20 percent of the parents who go online will stay online after the outbreak, and 80 percent of the parents who go online will stay offline. So I said that through these three months, the offline education institutions will also usher in small spring, bringing explosive growth.

But moving from offline to online doesn't always mean online learning, and I think the future of education and training will be offline and online fusion. But one of the advantages of offline companies over online only companies is that parents can choose to come to offline schools on a regular monthly basis, based on the analysis of data from their children's academic reports, the combination of online and offline will be a trend in education in the future, as face to face solutions to problems that can't be solved online.

Author | Enron editor | Kang Xiao
Production | Deep Net tencent Xiaoman studio

Author | Enron editor | Kang Xiao

Editor's Note: Crossing the economic cycle of the epidemic requires the upstream and downstream industries in China to work together to tide over the difficulties, how to deal with the offline branch temporarily closed, how to account for the company's cash flow and ensure the safety of employees and other issues.

Four days before the Chinese New Year, the company called on all staff to be on call 24 hours a day to take the initiative to suspend the offline operations of more than 2,000 of its offline educational institutions, within a dozen days of the outbreak, squirrel AI has been in "a state of readiness. ".

"during the outbreak, we had to make sure that the company's cash flow would keep us alive for two years, " Ai Founder Li Haoyang told deep web.

The Squirrel AI former Nghe School, founded in 2014. Since its establishment, it has received four rounds of financing with a total amount of nearly $1 billion. In June 2018, Nghe Education launched the "Squirrel AI" brand, with algorithm as the core, in the field of K12 education to launch an artificial intelligence adaptive learning engine. In 2018, the company's revenue nearly 1 billion, 2019 has opened nearly 2,000 offline teaching center.

Li Haoyang, the founder of Ai Squirrel, describes how the company handled the suspension of more than 2,000 offline educational institutions over a period of more than 10 days, how to account for the company's cash flow and ensure the safety of its employees.

Editor's Note: Crossing the economic cycle of the epidemic requires the upstream and downstream industries in China to work together to tide over the difficulties, how to deal with the offline branch temporarily closed, how to account for the company's cash flow and ensure the safety of employees and other issues.

Four days before the Chinese New Year, the company called on all staff to be on call 24 hours a day to take the initiative to suspend the offline operations of more than 2,000 of its offline educational institutions, within a dozen days of the outbreak, squirrel AI has been in "a state of readiness. ".

"during the outbreak, we had to make sure that the company's cash flow would keep us alive for two years, " Ai Founder Li Haoyang told deep web.

The Squirrel AI former Nghe School, founded in 2014. Since its establishment, it has received four rounds of financing with a total amount of nearly $1 billion. In June 2018, Nghe Education launched the "Squirrel AI" brand, with algorithm as the core, in the field of K12 education to launch an artificial intelligence adaptive learning engine. In 2018, the company's revenue nearly 1 billion, 2019 has opened nearly 2,000 offline teaching center.

Li Haoyang, the founder of Ai Squirrel, describes how the company handled the suspension of more than 2,000 offline educational institutions over a period of more than 10 days, how to account for the company's cash flow and ensure the safety of its employees.

Company-wide Combat Readiness Level One

Four days before the Spring Festival, the company went into a state of war. At that time, I sent a message to the group, asking all the staff of the company to be on call 24 hours a day. Even on New Year's Eve, many people were busy until midnight. In these four days, our work is divided into three main parts. One is to inform principals all over the country to unify their thinking, for the sake of children's health, to take the initiative to stop offline classes, and urge principals to implement.

At that time, some principals complained that the authorities had not asked for the suspension of classes. Why should we? After I explained that the incubation period could also be infected, each principal agreed to suspend classes, which moved me, because suspension means loss.

The second is to train teachers, because we have more than 10,000 offline teachers in the country have no experience of online teaching, we need to focus on training these teachers how to teach online.

Three is to mobilize all staff back to work, some teachers just do not have a sense of crisis, and I complained about their own just started on vacation, how to work in situ. And there are still some employees without computers, we have to focus on resolving the company's employees remote work problems.

I told some of the complaining employees that the company could be in danger if it didn't adjust its pace in time for special times. Therefore, we must change the usual work attitude and speed. It can be said that each employee working conditions and awareness, is the future survival of the company's expectations.

Under the mobilization of the company, all staff this more than 10 days to maintain a "state of readiness" , there are some programmers in their home remote office, ready to solve technical problems. Because wechat has a 9 person limit on teleconferencing, we use QQ to set up video conferencing.

From January 22 to February 3, we held 36 video conferences, the company's employees 80,000 people listen to live video training. The principal's combat readiness handbook, the staff Combat Readiness Handbook, the parent's communication handbook and the student's online study handbook have been produced.

Early on the morning of January 24, we launched an online education training program. At 15:30 that afternoon, junior high school math teaching and research staff began online training. At that time, 5,518 teachers participated in the online training. Those who could not attend the online training also consciously watched the playback when it was convenient for them. After that, English, Chinese and other subjects online teaching and training are carried out in an orderly manner.
We are online and offline, one body two wings, synergy development, offline students in school is also through the computer in the intellectual adaptation system to follow the Squirrel AI virtual teacher to learn. Ai Ai AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI AI. We have been teaching online for four or five years, and we are relatively experienced. In the process of pushing offline schools to online, there have been twists and turns, but the twists and turns we can bear.

Employees are not allowed to travel in vehicles with more than five passengers

On January 31, the company issued a notice to change the original return time from February 9 to February 15. At the same time, company policy, all employees before February 15 not allowed to use a variety of vehicles. Because I personally feel that on the return journey, the vehicle is probably the biggest hidden danger behind the development of the epidemic. If it were not for transportation, the outbreak would have decreased under the strict control of the state and the efforts of all walks of life. But the vehicles returning for the Spring Festival holiday could cause cross-infection. That's why we don't allow employees to return until the 15th, so they can work remotely from home.

Because we have offices in Beijing, Shanghai and other parts of the country, the company rules 15 starting return staff, not allowed to sit more than 5 people on the transport. Whether you drive or rent a car. Even a tricycle with a mask on is safer than public transportation.

After the return trip, the company stipulates that all activities and work can not be carried out in the office. If an employee needs to communicate face-to-face, we require no more than four people to communicate each time, and must wear a mask, one meter apart from each other in outdoor communication.

Cost cutting, cash flow accounting

Whether the educational enterprise can pass this critical three or four months mainly depends on the cash reserves on the books. We stress-tested the company a long time ago, and we have a consensus within the company that the company's cash flow at any time is always two years of operation, assuming that one year there is no financing, then the following year, the company will have to optimize costs and improve revenue efficiency again to ensure that the company has sufficient cash flow to ensure that the company two years of operation.

Now under the pressure of the epidemic, we re-take stock of the company's cash flow. We have to cut back on our spending and reduce our operating costs at a time when the company's revenues are likely to be sharply reduced. Cut All the costs that could be cut, such as redecorating a third of our new office space, paying down for meetings, marketing, etc. , to keep us alive for two years with our current cash flow.

I see Shanghai announced to extend the Social Insurance Payment period and tax support and other support policies, we are more confident to tide over the difficulties.

What needs to be pointed out here is that after the outbreak, we donated 3 million yuan to the Hubei Youth Foundation, and 2 million to buy computers and other equipment for the students in the affected areas who don't have the equipment at home, 5 million in cash donated by the co-operative schools, and 500 million worth of study accounts donated to the affected areas and users nationwide, all of which we have to spend, it's not part of our cost reduction, it's part of the cost increase during the epidemic.

The reason for giving free accounts to children in the affected areas and across the country is that we hope that every child will not be interrupted by the epidemic and forget their previous knowledge points and do not throw away their previous good study habits. I hope they can arrange their daily study, sports and entertainment. Plan your time well, especially after school starts, don't fall behind the schedule of school.

Some people have questioned whether the Education Company's Free Public Service is draining its customers, but the company's regular class costs hundreds of dollars and only has 16 hours, and this time it's all free and 90 hours, which is part of the real public service.

In addition, in order to enable children in the affected areas to "suspend classes without suspension, " we have worked with Hubei Zhijiang Yingjie school and Yichang Yingjie school to ensure that children attend school at home on time. A few days ago, these two schools have an experimental class opened.

In addition, our co-operation with Shiyan No. 2 Middle School in Hubei Province, Shashi District No. 1 Middle School in Jingzhou, Hubei Province, and Wudu Middle School in Ezhou, Hubei Province, is already in progress. Some students in Hubei Public Schools may use the company's intelligent adaptive system in the near future to solve the problem of delayed start-up.

After three months, education companies will see explosive growth

The problem with offline campuses now is that some parents will ask for refunds if they are unable to open classes for long periods of time, and if they don't have enough cash reserves, they are likely to run into cash flow difficulties, will face fixed costs such as rent, wages and other expenses; third, these months may not have new income enrollment.

Three or four months from now, when the epidemic is over, it will be a chance for us to rise from the ashes and grow at a rapid pace. So I personally believe that every education business must stabilize their cash flow at this time, as long as the difficulties over the past few months, will usher in explosive growth. After the end of the epidemic is expected, the concentration of the education and training market will further enhance.

The problem with offline campuses now is that some parents will ask for refunds if they are unable to open classes for long periods of time, and if they don't have enough cash reserves, they are likely to run into cash flow difficulties, will face fixed costs such as rent, wages and other expenses; third, these months may not have new income enrollment.

Three or four months from now, when the epidemic is over, it will be a chance for us to rise from the ashes and grow at a rapid pace. So I personally believe that every education business must stabilize their cash flow at this time, as long as the difficulties over the past few months, will usher in explosive growth. After the end of the epidemic is expected, the concentration of the education and training market will further enhance.

Two ways for educational institutions in primary and secondary schools to survive

Offline small and medium-sized training institutions to survive this three months, I think there are two ways.

The first is to find a way to solve the cash flow problem, over the past three months. The New Oriental, founded by Yu Minhong in 2003, survived the worst of the crisis with cash reserves and ten million loans, then experienced explosive growth.

The second is to find a big brand of education companies, together with the transformation line, in the current situation, a single small and medium-sized educational institutions alone is difficult to survive.

There are three advantages to combining big-brand education companies with online ones. One is that parents generally have a stronger sense of trust in big brands. With the trust of parents, parents will not be anxious to withdraw tuition fees, the proportion of parents may be reduced from more than 50% to 10% , education institutions can survive the first hurdle. Second, the offline training machine on-line, in this three months before classes can be canceled, pre-paid tuition can be turned into cash flow, after parents have the possibility of renewal fees. Otherwise, even if the parents do not have a centralized refund, formal education institutions can not spend these pre-paid tuition fees, no cancellation of tuition fees do not count as company income, this is the consensus in the industry. Third, in terms of new admissions, the months of the epidemic do not mean that there is no income from new admissions at all. The online marketing capabilities and experience of brands themselves are stronger, as some brands are giving away free accounts during the epidemic, and if parents and students have a particularly good learning experience during these months, some parents choose to keep their children online after the outbreak, while others choose to enroll in high value-added courses.

I estimate that over the course of three or four months, 20 percent of the parents who go online will stay online after the outbreak, and 80 percent of the parents who go online will stay offline. So I said that through these three months, the offline education institutions will also usher in small spring, bringing explosive growth.

But moving from offline to online doesn't always mean online learning, and I think the future of education and training will be offline and online fusion. But one of the advantages of offline companies over online only companies is that parents can choose to come to offline schools on a regular monthly basis, based on the analysis of data from their children's academic reports, the combination of online and offline will be a trend in education in the future, as face to face solutions to problems that can't be solved online.

Offline small and medium-sized training institutions to survive this three months, I think there are two ways.

The first is to find a way to solve the cash flow problem, over the past three months. The New Oriental, founded by Yu Minhong in 2003, survived the worst of the crisis with cash reserves and ten million loans, then experienced explosive growth.

The second is to find a big brand of education companies, together with the transformation line, in the current situation, a single small and medium-sized educational institutions alone is difficult to survive.

There are three advantages to combining big-brand education companies with online ones. One is that parents generally have a stronger sense of trust in big brands. With the trust of parents, parents will not be anxious to withdraw tuition fees, the proportion of parents may be reduced from more than 50% to 10% , education institutions can survive the first hurdle. Second, the offline training machine on-line, in this three months before classes can be canceled, pre-paid tuition can be turned into cash flow, after parents have the possibility of renewal fees. Otherwise, even if the parents do not have a centralized refund, formal education institutions can not spend these pre-paid tuition fees, no cancellation of tuition fees do not count as company income, this is the consensus in the industry. Third, in terms of new admissions, the months of the epidemic do not mean that there is no income from new admissions at all. The online marketing capabilities and experience of brands themselves are stronger, as some brands are giving away free accounts during the epidemic, and if parents and students have a particularly good learning experience during these months, some parents choose to keep their children online after the outbreak, while others choose to enroll in high value-added courses.

I estimate that over the course of three or four months, 20 percent of the parents who go online will stay online after the outbreak, and 80 percent of the parents who go online will stay offline. So I said that through these three months, the offline education institutions will also usher in small spring, bringing explosive growth.

But moving from offline to online doesn't always mean online learning, and I think the future of education and training will be offline and online fusion. But one of the advantages of offline companies over online only companies is that parents can choose to come to offline schools on a regular monthly basis, based on the analysis of data from their children's academic reports, the combination of online and offline will be a trend in education in the future, as face to face solutions to problems that can't be solved online.
